intro: Turraea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved turraea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries such as Nigeria and Cameroon. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Turraea macrophylla is often found in moist, shaded habitats within lowland rainforests.
